description.narrative: Degradation and encroachment of Sacred Forests halted
4 Increased scores on the GEF PA Management Effectiveness Tracking Tool METT for all five target sites within the 10 sacred forest clusters

comment.narrative:
see baseline values in cells further down
NOTE we made corrections as the values were wrong
For reference the baseline METT is in the PRODOC Annex 5

NOTE on logframe correction This indicator has changed since the inception but this had not been previously recorded in the PIR except in the cells further down The original PRODOC formulation for the target was All scores are greater than or equal to 40 by the MTE and all scores are greater than or equal to 50 by end of project Given the projects scope and constrained duration it had been agreed to keep target METT scores by project end at 40
Target can be considered achieved All scores more than 40 except for cluster 8 which is only slightly below target Refer to previous years reporting for more details

description.narrative: Sustainable use models around sacred forests are implemented on a demonstration basis

10 Communities perception of their livelihood stake in the good stewardship of sacred forest resources measured through the periodic and independent application of the Most Significant Change MSC technique

comment.narrative:
Not Applicable
The MSC technique is to be applied once the project has been launched and some form of change has occurred The baseline corresponds to all assessments that corroborate the situation analysis for this project particularly with respect to landuses and livelihoods
Changes in livelihoods are perceived through the independent application of the MSC technique

Not yet possible to assess the indicator as it should be confirmed by the TE Changes in livelihoods are perceived by the project team but this should be independently confirmed Refer to previous years reporting for more details

description.narrative: 9 Number of forest resources exploited in sustainable use regimes around sacred forests

comment.narrative: Resources from sacred forests are not necessarily being exploited in a sustainable manner

Programmes are in place in 10 of sites for the implementation of a MHP production b sustainable NTFP including Garcinia kola Khaya senegalensis small animal husbandry grasscutters apiculture heliciculture and mushrooms and c ecotourism and cultural tourism
Targets achieved for all three subindicators and consolidated Refer to previous years reporting for more details

description.narrative: To promote the sustainable use of Benins Sacred Forests as a network of communitymanaged conservation areas incorporated into the national system of protected areas
1 Sacred forests across Benin are protected and legally established as communitymanaged conservation areas

comment.narrative: 0 sacred forests are legally recognized as protected areas within Benins protected areas system
58 sacred forests are legally recognized as protected areas within Benins PA system
Target fully achieved and consolidated 58 sacred forests are legally recognized as protected areas within Benins PA system Refer to previous years reporting for more details

description.narrative: 3 Number of forest management and conservation committees established at the village level

comment.narrative: Few sacred forests are managed under informal arrangements involving traditional authorities and villages councils
58 sacred forests are managed using formal conservation management plans and village committees supervised by forest authorities

Target achieved and consolidated 58 sacred forests are managed using formal conservation management plans and village committees supervised by forest authorities Refer to previous years reporting for more details

description.narrative: 2 Status of emblematic species plant or animal within each sacred forest cluster

comment.narrative: No sacred forest has established a baseline for emblematic species of plants Garcinia kola and animal species Psittacus erithacus and Colobus vellerosus
A baseline of emblematic andor rare species of plants andor animal will be established within each one of the 10 sacred forest clusters at the start of project activities
